result.execSummary:
The defendant Taiwan Rayvon Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 9 days Rock Co Jail in lieu of $443 costs, consecutive to this sentence, concurrent with 12CF2132 and 14CM1174.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: January 15, 2016--Sentence After Revocation / Plea and Sentencing (full transcript filed in 12CF2132)

Defendant Taiwan Rayvon Edwards in court in custody with attorney Matthew Lantta.  Mark Matthew Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No contest plea, Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders 6 months Rock Co Jail, concurrent with 12CF2132 and 14CM1174; 138 days sentence credit; 9 days Rock Co Jail in lieu of $443 costs, consecutive to this sentence, concurrent with 12CF2132 and 14CM1174.

Defendant Taiwan Rayvon Edwards in court in custody with attorney Matthew Lantta.  Mark M. Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Taiwan Rayvon Edwards in court in custody with attorney Matthew Lantta.  Mark M. Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Taiwan Rayvon Edwards in court in custody with attorney Matthew Lantta.  Anne Theresa Nack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by court, jury trial to be set.
